channel.description:
EDIT: TOR worked fine, continue talking about how im a tool/doosh etc
heres the comment got me banned: http://forum.bodybuilding.com/showthread.php?t=148953503 im "Brobrahmirin"
The first time I was banned for saying "tight af pussy is my favorite m8, they scream and cry until I put the diaper back on"

item.title: Banned from bodybuilding.com for the second time, how change ip?
item.dc:creator: @mona_lisa mona lisa
item.description:
@mona_lisa wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:36, topic:464336”]Well yes but it isn’t all in the height.

You have to compare body type also

Who do you think will have an easier time gaining muscle

This guy who is 6’2’’
http://bodyspace.bodybuilding.com/img/user_images/growable/2008/10/14/16468412/progresspic/2052312orig.jpg

or this guy who is 6’2’’
http://bodyspace.bodybuilding.com/img/user_images/growable/2010/09/18/394152/profilepic/1O82KCTh6H5tbXM707DstoKrpD43h4522.jpeg

one already isn’t eating enough lol[/quote]

just only based on the bodies id pick kid number 1. nonetheless they pretty much have the same body type, both are way underweight for they height. You can take a kid with a solid foundation that doesnt have the drive to change his body and doesnt lift the correct ways, who eats horrible and who just lacks motivation. then you take a kid with hardly any muscle definition and you teach him to eat healthy and perform the lifts correctly and wants to look better and that kid will look far better then the other. Or you can be like zyzz and be scrawny as fuark and then take steroids and be aesthetic.

Read full topic

Niall:

were you made out of paper and fluff or something? that is ridiculously light

lolol

Dad is 5’3 and mom is 5’1, im 5’4’’

Nothing I can do about it. If I only cared about my weight then id endup looking like this:

I don’t lift to fuck myself up lul

My max bench to stay looking non-freakish I have to stop at 130. Most people with my build at 6’2’’ have no issues benching 250…

Its a very common myth because I was only 5’1 and 83 pounds when I started lifting.

item.title: Banned from bodybuilding.com for the second time, how change ip?
item.dc:creator: @Ashley3 Ashley
item.description:
@Ashley3 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:30, topic:464336”]Weightlifting doesn’t stunt growth m8. Im taller than both of my parents, I just come from a short family. But my moms side is actually tall and I only look 16, I still have time to gain an inch or two.[/quote]I’ve learnt from somewhere that doing over head work outs could stunt your growth

Read full topic
item.source: Banned from bodybuilding.com for the second time, how change ip?

item.title: Banned from bodybuilding.com for the second time, how change ip?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“mona lisa, post:28, topic:464336”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=568243.msg4126483#msg4126483 date=1350497373]

inb4 frell is 18 and weighs 135 pounds.

You’ve never visited the IRL Pictures thread have you?
[/quote]

i have. hes 5 foot 4 and he looks 135 pounds. its easy to look ripped when you weigh so little.[/quote]
Someone’s jealous. Im not even big, I just look better than the average guy. Im in the girl sweet spot where im not gross but im also not average.

Don’t try and make it sound easy or everyone my height would be ripped lul. Much more people 5’10’’ -> 6’2’’ that are ripped. Have you even seen my routine? I didn’t do a few pushups and situps everyday and look like this bro. 10-14 hours a week for 2.5 years.

Me: took 2 years to get to where I am at 5’4
Hodge twins: took 2 or 3 (not sure on the photo date) years to get to the taller version of me at 6’2’’ and 6’, plus they’re bigger. I look nowhere near as big as them and that’s expected because i’ve only worked out (Seriously) for about 2 years

Reason? We’re all mesomorphs.

But if I keep going ill look more ape-like before they do, that’s just the way it works. 30 pounds on me will look big compared to 30 pounds on a taller person, but the difference is only apparent when comparing two extremes (5’4’’ and 6’2’’) where if you compare 5’4’’ and 5’9’’ the different isn’t big at all, and neither is easy to achieve.

Tall people usually have bad eating habits, that’s why they don’t gain muscle as fast. They have to learn to eat.

To challenge your point my muscles are smaller so I automatically lift lighter than a taller person, so we grow at pretty much the same speed. But like I said, taller people have issues eating proportional to a shorter person. Someone my height only needs 2300 calories a day to support muscle growth, where someone 6’2’’ needs 3.5-6k a day depending on goals.

The final reason why tall people gain slower is because there is a good chance they’re ectomorphs: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ectomorphic

[quote=“Ashley, post:26, topic:464336”][quote author=Frell link=topic=568243.msg4126485#msg4126485 date=1350497407]
Im only 5’4’’ bros, can’t control my height though
[/quote]All them upper body workouts that’s stopped you from growing lol.[/quote]
Weightlifting doesn’t stunt growth m8. Im taller than both of my parents, I just come from a short family. But my moms side is actually tall and I only look 16, I still have time to gain an inch or two. Actually growth plate xrays and blood tests from a few years ago said theres a good change ill be 5’8’’, ill shit bricks.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:27, topic:464336”][quote author=Frell link=topic=568243.msg4126485#msg4126485 date=1350497407]
Im only 5’4’’ bros, can’t control my height though
[/quote]
You could, you just didn’t eat enough when you were young. And don’t worry, if you were tall we would just have hated you. (And you would be a douche bag)[/quote]
Not when your dads 5’3’’ and mom is 5’1’’

Read full topic
